fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition 
After entering text in Create issue screen and canceling the operation by hitting Cancel. A dialog box appears as below:

_You have entered new data on this page. if you navigate away from this page without first saving your data, the changes will be lost._
 !Capture.JPG|thumbnail! 

Accepting this dialog box for couple of times will result in Create Issue screen malfunctioning.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to JIRA Dashboard/JIRA Home
# Click on the issue creation button
# Enter some text in the *Summary* field
# Cancel the issue creation, a pop-up notification appears on the browser warning you'll loose changes.
# Click on the cancel button on the pop-up notification.
# Click on the issue creation button again
# Enter some text in the *Summary* field
# Cancel the issue creation again, same pop-up notification with *a check-box* appears on the browser warning you'll loose changes.
# Mark the check-box and click on the *OK* button
# Click on Create Issue again
# Enter some text in the *Summary* field
# Issue creation page will be unresponsive when we try to cancel the issue creation.

(!) This issue happens when user Edits the issue in Issue detail. 

h3. Workaround
Restarting browsers helps to reset the above setting.
fields.summary: Unable To Close The JIRA Issue Creation Page After loss Of Data jquery Warning

h3. Summary
As an Administrator I want to see progress for UPM update and it should prevent multiple runs of the update process.

h3. Environment
UPM: 2.19.1, 2.20.5, but may be not relevant. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Initiate updating of UPM at slow instance 
# Initiate 2nd updating of UPM

h3. Expected Results
UPM update will show progress and prevent multiple runs

h3. Actual Results
UPM update doesn't show progress and allow multiple runs
The below sequence can be observed in the log file:
{noformat}
1st update
2016-02-16 13:26:41,747 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-2 INFO a 692x2365x5 1o7c971 10.1.135.22 /rest/plugins/1.0/available/featured [atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler] Enabling 1 plugins: [com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-selfupdate-plugin]

... 1st shutdown process 

2nd Update
2016-02-16 13:29:42,116 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-4 INFO a 970x9981x5 14fqvd7 10.1.135.22 /rest/plugins/1.0/available/featured [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] Updating plugin 'com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-selfupdate-plugin' from version '2.20.4' to version '2.20.4'

2016-02-16 13:30:04,708 pool-20-thread-1 WARN a 810x136657x112 15lxknx 10.37.9.103 /rest/plugins/self-update/1.0/ [factory.transform.stage.ScanDescriptorForHostClassesStage] The plugin 'plugin.8719581164433502495.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin-2.20.5.jar' uses a package 'org.apache.velocity.tools.generic' that is also exported by the application.  It is highly recommended that the plugin use its own packages.
]

... 2nd shutdown process 

2016-02-16 13:35:01,151 pool-20-thread-1 INFO a 810x136657x112 15lxknx 10.37.9.103 /rest/plugins/self-update/1.0/ [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] Updating plugin 'com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin' from version '2.20.4' to version '2.20.5'

2016-02-16 13:36:45,164 pool-19-thread-1 INFO a 806x135761x95 15lxknx 10.37.9.103 /rest/plugins/self-update/1.0/ [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] Updating plugin 'com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin' from version '2.20.4' to version '2.20.5'

2016-02-16 13:36:46,668 pool-19-thread-1 INFO a 806x135761x95 15lxknx 10.37.9.103 /rest/plugins/self-update/1.0/ [atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler] Resolving 28 plugins
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
From: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-5277 
Okay, here is the root of the problem. We do display progress on the page but we could display it in a better fashion. For most add-ons UPM will "resume" progress if the page is refreshed mid-installation, but this is a bit of an edge case because UPM loses track of the installation state while installing itself.

*In summary*:
* We can improve our progress dialog to be clearer that something is still ongoing.
* If you think your service might be stuck, you should check the logs for behind-the-scenes activity prior to restarting the installation.

h3.Workaround
Check JIRA logs for update events.
fields.summary: As an Administrator I want to see progress for UPM update

  {panel}

G'Day Atlassian,

As per my user base, this is the request for referencing a comment within another comment in JIRA:

"When referring to a comment within another comment, embedding the full URL to the reference comment unnecessarily clutters the comment. It would be much more convenient to be able to have the link copied from a previous comment be pasted into the new comment as a labeled link rather than as the full URL. So the steps would be: 1) Right-click the previous comment's chain-link-sign to copy the link 2) Use a button in the new comment to paste a reference to the previous comment as a labeled hyperlink such as 'Comment NNNN'. Currently I can work around this by doing the labeling of the URL myself but it would be convenient to make it a one-step operation."

Thanks,
Robert

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59832].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Previously in JIRA version 7.0.10 and older, when user import XML backup even with Agile data, JIRA will be upgrading all the Agile data automatically. With JIRA 7.1.0, if the user tries to import a XML backup of a JIRA instance which is using JIRA Agile version 6.7 and below, they will be prompted with the following error:

* Sorry, your data contains JIRA Agile data from previous version that is not compatible for import. Please upgrade to JIRA Agile 6.7 and try again.*

*Suggested Solution*
Since prior to JIRA 7.1.0, JIRA was able to handle the upgrade task automatically, implemented the same upgrade task should be ideal for the users.

*Workaround*
User will have to upgrade their source JIRA instance's JIRA Agile to version 6.7 and above, create new XML backup and restore that backup in the target JIRA instance. 


{panel:title=Brydie McCoy [Atlassian] }
Unfortunately it was becoming too difficult to maintain older upgrade tasks, so in 7.1.0 the Agile team removed upgrade tasks older than 12 months.
You can either
Upgrade JIRA Agile to 6.7.x on their original instance (for JIRA 6.3, 6.4 and 6.5). Or;
Import the data into a JIRA Software 7.0.0 instance first. (or upgrade the original instance to 7.0.0)
Both of these scenarios will run the required upgrade tasks.
Cheers,
JIRA Software Team
{panel}
fields.summary: JIRA 7.1.X Agile related update error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59828].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When calling the REST API using unencoded basic authentication, a non-ASCII character in the username or password will return an incorrect status - a 401 Unauthorized or a 403 Forbidden respectively.

This does not impact the {{rest/auth/1/session}} endpoint. For more information on how to use this endpoint instead, please [Cookie-based Authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/cookie-based-authentication/].

This also does not impact a user's ability to log in - as the browser and form will correctly encode data before sending it back to the server.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with non-ASCII character name like "łukasz" and the password test
# Login through the web UI as that user, to verify the credentials are valid.
# Do rest call as the user:
{code}
curl -u łukasz:test -I http://localhost:8090/jira/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-2"
{code}

(i) The problem can exhibit with a non-ascii character in either the username or the password.

h3. Expected Results
With the correct credentials, the issue return a 200 OK response.

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
Date: Thu, 18 Feb 2016 10:53:23 GMT
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=91304E14DAA60D5A14292013A062A13B; Path=/jira/; HttpOnly
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Vary: User-Agent
WWW-Authenticate: OAuth realm="http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8090%2Fjira"
X-AREQUESTID: 1313x7361x1
X-ASEN: SEN
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-Seraph-LoginReason: AUTHENTICATED_FAILED
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
See [ACJIRA-513|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-513] description and comments for more details.

h3.Workaround
There are a few alternative options workarounds; depending on the exact implementation you're using.

h4.Option 1 - Remove the non-ascii characters
If possible, change the non-ascii characters to ascii characters. This may not be desirable (or feasible) in all cases, however.

h4.Option 2 - Encode the username and password as Base64 before sending
Use the following command to generate a Base64 encoded string:
{code}
echo -n 'username:password' | openssl base64
{code}

Then, supply an {{Authorization: Basic token}} header, like so:

{code}
curl -X GET http://localhost:8090/jira/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-2 -H 'Authorization: Basic dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ='
{code}

h4.Option 3 - Use Cookie authentication

{panel:title=Information|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
(i) In some cases, we've seen a Base64 encoded string fail. In our testing, this _seems_ to be caused by an ASCII username, with a non-ascii character in the password. If you're seeing a Base 64 encoded string fail (and you're sure it's correct) then consider using the cookie method of authentication.
{panel}

You can use [cookie based authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/cookie-based-authentication/] to authenticate first, and then use the cookie as your authentication mechanism in subsequent requests.
fields.summary: Basic authentication does not support non-ascii characters in usernames or password

fields.description:
h4. Summary
The dark feature {{frother.assignee.field}} is completely obsolete and should be on for everyone. We should drop support for it. 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
frother.assignee.field = true
{code}

h4. Notes
In JIRA 5.x  Assignee drop down list has been enhanced to show only "Suggested users initially" and only after typing in at least 1 character the valid Assignees are shown matching that character. See KB: [How+to+fully+render+assignee+drop-down+list+in+JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fully+render+assignee+drop-down+list+in+JIRA]
Disabling this feature will cause performance problems, see [JRA-59786|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-59786]
fields.summary: Drop support for obsolete feature frother.assignee.field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59822].
  {panel}

h4. Requirement
Currently, JIRA will log slow queries in {{atlassian-slow-queries.log}} that run longer than 400ms. This value is hardcoded, cannot be adjusted. It would be extremely beneficial for troubleshooting purposes to able to modify the threshold, to see less "noise" and focus on longer running queries only.

h4. Proposed solution
Either have a [system property|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/recognized-system-properties-for-jira-229180062.html] that would override the default value, or even a more administrator-friendly solution would be to have this adjustable runtime on the Administration UI.
fields.summary: Option to adjust slow queries log threshold

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When it comes to JIRA 7.x, they start to use *NVARCHAR* columns instead of *VARCHAR* columns in *AO_xxx* tables (like *AO_60DB71_SPRINT*) on SQL Server for the purpose of avoiding [AO-386|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AO-386]. (FYI. JIRA 7.x start to use the fixed version of ao-plugin.)
However, only the case that we upgrade JIRA from the earlier version than JIRA 7.x, the columns are not migrated correctly.

h3. Environment
* OS
*- Windows
* DB
*- SQL Server
* JIRA
*- Before upgrading : JIRA 6.x
*- After upgrading : JIRA 7.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.x and JIRA Agile
# Setup the JIRA instance to use SQL Server as the external DB
# Upgrade the JIRA instance to JIRA 7.x

h3. Expected Results
*VARCHAR* columns should be migrated correctly to *NVARCHAR* columns.

h3. Actual Results
*VARCHAR* columns are still *VARCHAR* columns after the upgrading.

h3. Notes
* This bug might lead to multibytes character problems.
* Causes JSWSERVER-15917 

h3.Workaround
* Alter the tables manually
* Export the data as XML from the instance and import it to a new instance

h5. Example of workaround for {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK}} table
Example of workaround for {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK}} table. Similar approach can be done for other tables. 

# Stop JIRA.
# Backup your database.
# Delete all indexes from the table {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK}}, *except for the primary key*.
# Change the data type on the columns {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK.RANK}} and {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK.LOCK_HASH}} using these SQL queries:
{code:sql}
ALTER TABLE dbo.AO_60DB71_LEXORANK ALTER COLUMN RANK NVARCHAR(255) NOT NULL;
ALTER TABLE dbo.AO_60DB71_LEXORANK ALTER COLUMN LOCK_HASH NVARCHAR(255) NULL;
{code}
# Run the following SQL queries to flush caches and update statistics on the database:
{code:sql}
DBCC FREEPROCCACHE;
SP_UPDATESTATS;
{code}
# Start JIRA. The indexes for the table {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK}} will be automatically recreated.
fields.summary: VARCHAR columns in AO_xxx tables on SQL Server are not migrated correctly to NVARCHAR columns when upgrading to JIRA 7.x

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Description*

Affects dashboards containing both Connect add-ons and Atlassian Gadgets.  The configuration of Connect add-ons are being lost when an Atlassian gadget is edited and saved or a new gadget is added to the dashboard. 

The following warning is added to {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{noformat}
2016-02-15 16:05:40,903 http-nio-8949-exec-12 WARN rrosa 965x357x1 1ysb5vd 192.168.10.162 /rest/dashboards/1.0/10000/gadget/10100/prefs [c.a.jira.dashboard.JiraDashboardStateStoreManager] Stored state for dashboard with id '10000' is not the same as in-memory state. Trying to rewrite the entire state...
{noformat}
*Steps to reproduce*
 # Open a dashboard
 # Click add a new gadget -> Bubble Chart, and configure it
 # After the Bubble Chart is shown, refresh the page and note that the chart is still there
 # In the same dashboard, click add a new gadget -> load all gadgets -> Created vs. Resolved Chart, configure it, and save

h3. Expected Results: 

New gadget is added. Previously configured connect add-ons retain their configuration. 
h3. Actual Results: 

New gadget is added. Previously configured connect add-ons lose their configuration. Following is logged in atlassian-jira.log: 
{code:java}
2017-09-26 15:29:58,573 http-nio-8736-exec-15 WARN admin 929x354x1 144r0n4 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/dashboards/1.0/10100/gadget/10102/prefs [c.a.jira.dashboard.JiraDashboardStateStoreManager] Stored state for dashboard with id '10100' is not the same as in-memory state. Trying to rewrite the entire state...
2017-09-26 15:30:53,109 http-nio-8736-exec-7 WARN admin 930x426x1 144r0n4 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/dashboards/1.0/10100/gadget/10103/prefs [c.a.jira.dashboard.JiraDashboardStateStoreManager] Stored state for dashboard with id '10100' is not the same as in-memory state. Trying to rewrite the entire state...{code}
h3. Notes:  

Gadgets that trigger the behavior: Hide Gadgets, Favourite Filters, Assgined to Me, Issues in progress, Voted Issues, Watched Issues, Quick Links, Filter Results, Issue Statistics, Two Dimensional, Filter Statistics, Projects, Pie Chart, Resolution Time, Created vs. Resolved Chart, Average Age Chart, Time Since Chart, Recently Created Chart, Labels Gadget.
h4. Workaround

None. Any connect add-ons need to be re-configured by user.
fields.summary: Dashboard Gadget configuration is lost when editing a dashboard

  {panel}

*SUMMARY*
Users without Browse Users permission are able to get autocomplete for assignee field in JIRA issues.

This does *not* affect JIRA issue navigator basic mode for assignee dropdown.

*STEPS TO REPLICATE*
# Create a user without *Browse Users* global permission
# Create an issue
# Try to edit the issue's assignee

*EXPECTED RESULT*
JIRA shouldn't provide users without *Browse Users* permission to get autocomplete feature for usernames - only using complete usernames to assign the issues to others.

# Install JIRA 7.1.
# Attempt to update or install a new Add-on through the UPM (Universal Plugin Manager) or attempt to install an Add-on Such as JIRA Software or JIRA Service Desk from Application Administration. 

h3. Expected Results
When an add-on is installed, the plugin should be available and reported as installed and running. 

h3. Actual Results
When the add-on is installed, the files are downloaded, but then a "PluginInstallException" is thrown reporting: "Failed to install OBR jar artifact".

Restart JIRA. This will automatically enable any plugins that failed to enable successfully (they will already exist in the {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} directory, however were not enabled).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59796].
  {panel}

h3. Summary 

If you haven't yet created a fix version in project admin -> versions, then it isn't possible to edit the "fix version/s" field anywhere.
I.e. you see this (e.g. on edit issue dialog, or view):
!Screen Shot 2016-02-14 at 4.03.17 pm.png|width=500px!

But then once you've created at least one fix version, you see this:
!Screen Shot 2016-02-14 at 4.07.56 pm.png|width=500px!

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new project (without any fix versions added yet)
# Ensure the "fix version/s" field is on all required screens, inside the correct schemes etc (e.g. view and edit screens)
# Ensure the current user has "resolve issue" permission (required to edit the "fix version/s" field)
# Create a new issue and navigate to it
# Open the edit dialog

h3. Expected result:
The "fix version/s" field is editable, with the option to choose "new version"

h3. Actual result:

The field is not editable, with value displayed as *None*

h3. Workaround

Add the new version from Project Administration.

h3. Notes

It *is* possible to create new "fix versions" from the drop-down, so this restriction shouldn't exist.
fields.summary: Can't set fix version if one doesn't exist yet

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition:
JAVA API changes introduced in JIRA 7.1 prevent compatibility with JIRA 7.0. This is seen in DefaultClauseHandler and DefaultValuesGeneratingClauseHandler

h5. Example:

JIRA 7.1:
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.1.0/com/atlassian/jira/jql/DefaultClauseHandler.html  
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.1.0/com/atlassian/jira/jql/DefaultValuesGeneratingClauseHandler.html

JIRA 7.0:
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.0.0/com/atlassian/jira/jql/DefaultClauseHandler.html 
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.0.0/com/atlassian/jira/jql/DefaultValuesGeneratingClauseHandler.html

The constructor of the ClauseHandler added an additional parameter: 
{noformat}
DbClauseQueryFactory dbFactory
{noformat}

h5. Suggested Solution:
Introduce backward compatibility this API change.
fields.summary: Changes in 7.1 JAVA API not compatible with 7.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59793]. {panel} h3. Issue Summary Pre-formatted is the style type that gives monospacing to text. This is traditionally used when referring to code (variable names, class names, etc...) or short pieces of code. h3. Steps to Reproduce Write a text in the description of an issue with content like the following: "The HTTP response came back as {{{"result" : "success"}}} but ..." h3. Expected Results The text is shown as it was written, in one single uninterrupted line. h3. Actual Results The text is shown with line breaks instead of a single line. h3. Notes * The impetus for this is javadocs which support tags such as: variableName ( does the same thing) which will give monospace typing to variableName. Javadocs also support 
a bunch of code here
which is handy for formatting a lot of code. JIRA handles the 
 situation quite well with the "code" tags. It makes an attempt to handle in-line monospace typing with "Preformatted". This works well most of the time, but it is completely broken when trying to use with JSON code snippets.
* JavaDocs and other formatting tools support inline monospacing on code snippets for readability purposes, so should JIRA. In fact, Preformatting works well with code snippets for nearly any language EXCEPT JSON.

h3. Workaround
To use the "code" formatting. Example: 
{code}The HTTP response came back as {{{"result" : "success"}}} but ...{code}
fields.summary: Preformatted style with JSON text is broken

  {panel}

h3. Summary
I did [change the format|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/changing-the-due-date-input-format-192536.html] for both Date and Date Time picker but the look and feel is not showing the correct format. Lets say I used the format for DateTime and Date picker as
- jira.date.picker.java.format=yyyy-MM-dd
- jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%Y-%m-%d
- jira.date.time.picker.java.format=yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm
- jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%Y-%m-%d %H:%M 

Set the date as 
Date=02/09/1900
DateTIme=1900-02-02 18:02
- When viewing it via browsing it image A ( Format is showing differently in UI )
- When you try to edit it image B & C ( These looks fine )
- When you export it via excel image D ( DatePicker format/data is wrong ). 
Verified in backend and dates are correct.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA as SYS Admin
# [Change Date and Date time format||https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/changing-the-due-date-input-format-192536.html] using above format.

h3. Expected Results
Format in UI and extracting data for DatePicker should be same data and format.

h3. Actual Results
Check Image A and Image D column DatePicker field.
 

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Date/DateTime Picker log format different in UI and Date exported to excel shows different date

# Migrate to an alternative Database such as Postgres [as per out documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/switching-databases-749382658.html].
# Downgrade the JIRA Instance (detailed below)
# Follow the steps below to control the inaccessible functionality. 

h4. To workaround this bug with using the REST API: 
*To simply get information about the application Roles using the [REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/]:*
# Log into JIRA 
# Access: {{<BASE-URL>/rest/api/2/applicationrole}}, which will return a JSON Response with details of the JIRA Application Users. 

*To Add or Remove a Group to a License Role*
# Use a REST Client to call the following as per [the REST API - Update Application Role|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/applicationrole-get]: 
{noformat}
<base-url>/rest/api/2/applicationrole/{key}
{noformat}

h4. To Downgrade your JIRA instance to JIRA 7.0.10
# Make a full backup of your environment as in: [Backing up data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Backing+up+data]
# Ensure JIRA 7.1.0 instance is shutdown.
# Install JIRA 7.0.10 into this environment, but not into the same JIRA Install as your 7.1.0 as this will not work.
# Shutdown the JIRA 7.0.10 instance once it has started.  
# Any customisations and data that you have in your JIRA 7.1.0 environment should be migrated to ensure that your JIRA 7.0.10 has these configurations. 
## Copy over any configuration changes that you have made as per our [Upgrading JIRA applications with a fallback method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Upgrading+JIRA+applications+with+a+fallback+method]. 
## Copy over Avatars and attachments to your new instance as in [Upgrading JIRA applications with a fallback method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Upgrading+JIRA+applications+with+a+fallback+method].
## Migrate any installed-plugins that you would like to install into this JIRA 7.0.10 environment. Note: do not migrate the plugins from your 7.1.0 environment, as this will contain 7.1.0 Add-ons that you should not include.
# Set the flag {{-Djira.downgrade.allowed=true}} as per: [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Setting+properties+and+options+on+startup]
# Start JIRA 7.0.10
# When asked for connection information to the database, point to the 7.1.0 JIRA database (if you did not copy the {{dbconfig.xml}} file when copying configuration files.)
# The instance should now start and downgrade the JIRA database data. The JIRA version should be reported as 7.0.10.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59788].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
Currently, when a project has been archived, this archive state is achieved by removing all permissions other than the browse project permission.

However, as voting and watching issues do not have any permissions associated with them at project level, users are able to still vote and watch archived issues.

*Feature*
Can a feature be added that prevents modifying an archived issue entirely or can project level permissions be added for the vote and watch issue features?
fields.summary: Restrict ability to Vote and Watch Archived Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA bulk edit extremely slow and can timeout in {{BulkEditDetails.jspa}} call. There are two serious inefficiencies it the method: com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.Assignees#bulkOptionsForHtmlSelect which is enabled when {{frother.assignee.field}} to _false_

In JIRA 5.x  Assignee drop down list has been enhanced to show only "Suggested users initially" and only after typing in at least 1 character the valid Assignees are shown matching that character. See KB: [How+to+fully+render+assignee+drop-down+list+in+JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fully+render+assignee+drop-down+list+in+JIRA]

h3. Environment
JIRA with high number of assignable users (10k)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run search criteria for the 20x issues to edit for project with high number of assignable users (10k)
# Choose BulkChange
# Choose Edit all issues

h3. Expected Results
You get to _Step 3_ and it's fast

h3. Actual Results
{{BulkEditDetails.jspa}} is very slow or time-out 

h3. Notes
None. 

h3.Workaround
Set {{frother.assignee.field}} to _true_
fields.summary: JIRA bulk edit extremely slow for large users list  when frother.assignee.field = false

fields.description:
1. The Bug happens if you use the language "German" (maybe other languages except English that uses characters like ä, ö, ü, [Germanic umlaut https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germanic_umlaut])
2. The Bug happens if you use the datepicker in month March (German: März)
3. If you use the date picker and click a date in March. e.g. 02.03.2016 the value is 2/Mrz/16 but it should 2/Mär/16.
4. If you save it with 2/Mrz/16 you get an error message, but the user don't understand ist because the date format seems ok. If you change it manually in 2/Mär/16 it works.

Screenshots attached
fields.summary: German (DE) date picker Mrz Bug

h3. Summary
The default permission scheme cannot be edited. Editing causes a blank page with NPE.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the permission scheme to include a single user.
# Remove the user from user management
# Load Permission Scheme
# Edit the system Default Permission Scheme

h3. Expected Results
Default Permission Scheme is loaded
h3. Actual Results
A blank Page is shown
JIRA logs displays below error
{noformat}
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018914500 2016-02-12 09:05:51,015 http-nio-2990-exec-3 ERROR sysadmin 545x434x1 13irxx6 103.233.242.8,104.192.140.49,127.0.0.1 /rest/internal/2/managedpermissionscheme/11900 [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018916500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018916500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.updateSchemeToReturnUsername(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:436)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018917500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.access$2200(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:58)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018951500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:331)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018951500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018952500 	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option$Some.fold(Option.java:421)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018952500 	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option.flatMap(Option.java:287)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018956500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018957500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getPermissionScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:105)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018962500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.getManagedPermissionScheme(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:92)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018962500 	... 3 filtered
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* Cloning the default permission scheme causes the same problem.
* Using the delete user API will delete these records.
* It appears that this can be caused by deleting users from a user directory (by removing that directory), or through other means.

h3.Workaround
For Cloud, please contact Support. For server:

Can fix this with:
# Execute the below SQL to identify problematic records:
{code:SQL}
select * from schemepermissions where perm_type = 'user' and (perm_parameter in (select user_key from app_user where lower_user_name not in (select lower_user_name from cwd_user)) or perm_parameter not in (select user_key from app_user));
{code}
# Stop JIRA.
# Backup the JIRA database using the native DB tools.
# Remove the problematic records.
# Start JIRA.
# Test by editing the scheme.

If there's any issues with the update, roll-back to the backup. For additional help please raise a support case at [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: Permission Scheme cannot be edited when it includes a single user

fields.description:
h3 .Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to issue navigator and perform a search that returns 1000 issues.
2. Bulk edit that issue and change the assignee field

h3. Notes
The class {{com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.Assignees}} is a helper to the Assignee System field.

During Bulk Edit it loads a list of Suggested Assignees using the method {{bulkOptionsForFrotherControl}}, which sounds like a fine idea, but to do this it trawls through the change history of *all 1000* issues to get a list of to whom they were recently assigned.  This obviously takes a lot of CPU and Database IO to achieve - See the profiler screenshot.

I think if this were limited to the last few (25?) most recently updated/created issues or something similar we would achieve the desired result. Remembering that this is just to fill in the drop downs for the Assignee field on the off chance that is what the user actually wants to update.
fields.summary: Loading suggested assignees from the Bulk Edit Wizard suffers from poor performance

# # go to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/
# start typing in the advanced "search" bar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you try to load JIRA and the system is not 100% up, the browser used to stay loading until the application was ready. Once it was ready, you would be sent to the Dashboard or to the Setup Wizard.

Now, when you load JIRA and the app is not ready, you are sent to {{http://localhost:8080/startup.jsp?returnTo=%2Fdefault.jsp}} and it will not redirect you when done. It stays on this page forever. If you reload the page or open a new tab and try to load JIRA, it will load immediately.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start JIRA and, immediately after that;
# Try to access JIRA through the browser. You should be sent to {{http://localhost:8080/startup.jsp?returnTo=%2Fdefault.jsp}}.

h3. Expected Results
You should be sent to the Dashboard or the Setup Wizard once JIRA has finished loading.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens and the page does not redirect to JIRA's landing page.


h3. Workaround:
Give a couple of minutes (so JIRA finishes loading) and reload the page.
fields.summary: JIRA Startup does not redirect properly once JIRA loads
See referenced stories
View panel can not be resized in the issue navigator details view

        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2197)
        ... 17 more
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Add the [validation query|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/surviving-database-connection-closures-297665664.html] to dbconfig.xml and restart JIRA.  An example {{dbconfig.xml}} is below - this will need to have the {{username}}, {{password}}, {{scheme}} and {{url}} changed for your instance:

{noformat}
<jira-database-config>
<name>defaultDS</name>
<delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
<database-type>mssql</database-type>
<schema-name>jiraschema</schema-name>
<jdbc-datasource>
  <url>jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://dbserver:1433/jiradb</url>
  <driver-class>net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver</driver-class>
  <username>jiradbuser</username>
  <password>password</password>
  <pool-min-size>20</pool-min-size>
  <pool-max-size>20</pool-max-size>
  <pool-max-wait>30000</pool-max-wait>
  <pool-max-idle>20</pool-max-idle>
  <pool-remove-abandoned>true</pool-remove-abandoned>
  <pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>300</pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>
 
  <validation-query>select 1</validation-query>
  <min-evictable-idle-time-millis>60000</min-evictable-idle-time-millis>
  <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>300000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>

  <pool-test-while-idle>true</pool-test-while-idle>
  <pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow>
</jdbc-datasource>
</jira-database-config>
{noformat}

You can refer to the documentation on connecting JIRA to SQL Server for sample dbconfig.xml file:
- [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2008-749382647.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2008-749382647.html]
- [Connecting JIRA applications to SQL Server 2012|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2012-792297796.html]

h3. Notes

This appears to be caused by the jTDS driver as detailed in http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26404283/java-hibernate-with-sql-server-2012-not-working.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary

 A  customer (Jira Service Desk) can be added as a watcher to a jira-software issue.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Service Desk Project and JIRA Software Project.
# Invite or Create a Service Desk Customer  i.e "usera" (user without any permissions or application access) to JSD project. 
# Login as a user with the manage watchers permission i.e. "userb" on a JIRA software project. 
# Create JIRA Service Desk issue "TESTA" and JIRA Software issue "TESTB".
# Add customer "usera" as a watcher to the JIRA Service Desk issue i.e "TESTA".
# Add customer "usera" as a watcher to JIRA Software issue i.e. TESTB.

h3. Expected Results
*Test A.)* Adding a customer "usera "as watcher to a Jira Service Desk issue "TESTA" would not be allowed as it only applies to jira-users with the correct permission not customers. The customer should be added as a [Request Participant| https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/adding-request-participants-732528959.html]  to the JIRA Service Desk issue instead. 
*Test B)* Adding a JIRA Service Desk customer "usera" as watcher with (no application access or Jira permissions to the JIRA software project/issue) should not be allowed. 

h3. Actual Results

*Test A.)*  Adding  customer "usera" as a watcher to JSD issue "TESTA") results in a permissions issue "The user "usera" does not have permission to view this issue. This user will not be added to the watch list."  
*Test B.)* Customer is added as a watcher to the jira-software issue (with no jira-software or permission access to the project/issue) and can receive issue updates.

h3. Notes
I was able to reproduce this in my test instance JIRA v7.1.0-OD-06-005 with JSD Version: 3.2.0-OD-01-002-D20160204T062648  and JIRA Server 7.0.10 and JSD  v3.0.10.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk customers can be added as watchers to JIRA Software and JIRA Core issues.

fields.description:
h2. These defined columns often don't get saved when creating a filter
*STEPS TO REPRODUCE:*
1. Access to some filter with a different columns that you used to work with.
2. Save it in your filters.
3. Set "My Defaults" columns as prefered view of the tickets.
4. Switch to another filter.
5. Switch back to your filter.

*EXPECTED:*
Filter looks like I left it.

*ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR:*
Filter switches from "My Defaults" to "Filter" columns.

h2. When selecting the "My Defaults" option it's not sticky. After every sort or modification to the search query, the column view is being reset.
*STEPS TO REPRODUCE:*
1. Go to the filter created recently.
2. Modify the search in the query OR sort by any column. 

*EXPECTED:*
The column view stays as it was before sort or search query modification.

*ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR:*
After every sort or modification to the search query the column view is being reset
fields.summary: Selected Jira columns are not sticky in list view and for filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59742].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In other browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, IE11, IE10), you can use the 'tab' key to navigate through the header bar, down the sidebars, and into the pages. However, in Safari 'tab' takes you to the search field, and maybe a few page elements, but does not go along the JIRA header or sidebars.

h3. Environment
* Browser: Safari 8.0.2
* OS: Mac OS X 10.10.1
* Java: 1.8.0_40

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JIRA in Safari
# Navigate with tab key on any page (first noticed in the project administration section)

h3. Expected Results
Navigating with the tab key should cycle through all the selectable elements on the page.

h3. Actual Results
The selection moves from the the browser search bar, along browser bookmarks, into the JIRA search bar, maybe onto some other page elements. However, it does not select items across the JIRA header or sidebar elements (both project central sidebar and project administration sidebar).

h3.Workaround
Navigation and selection with the mouse is not affected and can be used as normal. Could use another browser.
fields.summary: Tab keyboard navigation doesn't work in Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a screen to a transition, the option to click Browse when uploading an attachment no longer displays. The option to Browse shows up in all other cases (Edit Issue, View Issue, etc)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a screen 
# Add the screen to a workflow transition such as Done
# Click Done on an issue and click on Attachment icon. The Browse option does not show

h3. Expected Results
Clicking on the Attachment icon displays the option to Browse

h3. Actual Results
The Browse option does not show

h3. Workaround
Use Edit Issue or View Issue screen for browse feature
fields.summary: Adding A Screen In A Workflow Transition Results In Loss Of Browse Feature When Clicking Attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59737].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Original: The option paste screen shots from "More" is available in certain jira projects while not in others.  I did look at JRA-47028, but that still does not answer why it is available in some and not others.  Thanks

Having a JIRA ticket opened as a result of search per figure  (issue navigator split view): 
 !Attach Screenshot yes.jpg|thumbnail!  
the option Attach Screenshot is available when click More.

But opening same issue in detailed view (standalone view issue page) per this figure: 
 !Attach Screenshot No.jpg|thumbnail! 
The option Attach Screenshot is not available when click More.

h3. Steps To Reproduce

# Open a JIRA ticket in detailed view, per screenshot attached above.
# Click More button

h3. Expected Behavior

The user should not be able to see the Attach Screenshot option under Attach Files

h3. Actual Behavior

The attach screenshot is available when searching for the issue (ServiceDesk Queue or any other search result, issue navigator split view).
fields.summary: The "Attach Screenshot" menu item is still available depending how you query the JIRA ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59736].
  {panel}


h3. Problem Definition

----

When an issue doesn't meet the criteria of a workflow validator the error messages aren't intuitive to resolving the validation issue. 

i.e.

- Have a workflow validator that checks that the parent status is in a particular status for a subtask on a workflow. 

!wkfw.png|thumbnail!

If you try to create the subtask you get an error that it has unsupported content in an issue field and to contact your admin to check the log file for specific info. 

Error creating issue:
!error.png|thumbnail!

We see the exact error in the logs:

com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: Transition is not authorized because current Issue's parent Issue should be in one of the following statuses: [To Do, Selected for Development, Reopened, Scheduled for development, In Progress, Backlog]

----

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Provide more specific information relative to the validation error via the UI instead of the logs similar to a workflow helper such as [where is my field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-admin-helper-376834956.html#JIRAAdminHelper-FieldHelper] available from the issue view to identify the cause. 

----
h3. Workaround 

1.) Reproduce the issue.
2.) Tail the logs at the time or check the general time frame the issue occurred in the logs. 
----
fields.summary: Improve UI error messages related to workflow validators.

fields.description:
If you choose an Event JQL but do not select any events and then only tie the WebHook to Workflow Post Functions, JIRA will follow the JQL chosen and will only fire the WebHook for issues that are within the range of search, but the JQL is not shown in the WebHooks page until you click on Edit.

This makes harder to view what is the JQL in use for that WebHook.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new WebHook, add a JQL in the Issue Related Events and do not select any events.
# Tie the WebHook to some Workflow Post Functions
# Save the WebHook.

h3. Expected Results:

JIRA displays the JQL

h3. Actual Results:

You are only able to see the JQL if you edit the WebHook.
fields.summary: WebHook not showing JQL for Post Function based WebHooks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It is not possible to search the 2nd strong of a field name from the Order by list on the issue navigator using Detail View


h3. Environment
* Detail View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the Issue Navigator
# Select Detail View
# Type in Date on the Order by Search 


h3. Expected Results
It should return Due Date

h3. Actual Results
It returns "No Matches"
 !image-2016-02-09-16-12-04-167.png|thumbnail! 

However if you type the first string of the word it returns Due Date
 !image-2016-02-09-16-12-50-881.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
This bug can be reproduced with any field name with more than 1 string for example :
# Fix Versions/s
# Issue TYpe
# Affects Versions/s

h3.Workaround
Search the first word or letter of the field name.
fields.summary: Second string for fields on Order by list not searchable

JIRA 7.0.x changes icon files for attachments from former version and it makes user confused. (JSP-260608)
For example,  if user attaches Excel file, JIRA displays 
- JIRA70.png on JIRA 7.0.x
- JIRA64.png on JIRA 6.4 && any former versions

JIRA 7.0 still has atlassian-jira/images/icons/attach/excel.gif and attachmentsblock.soy in jira-view-issue-plugin-7.0.x.jar refers it, so it is nice to provide the configuration that user can choice icon files as user can modify issue-type icon/priority icon to make user experience more simple and to keep UI consistency.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Use "attached Excel files" same icon file (atlassian-jira/images/icons/attach/excel.gif)

fields.description:
h4. Diagnosis:

After restoring an index from a snapshot (backup) file, many issues are missing.

An error similar to the following may be present in the application logs:
{noformat}
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Destination '/jira-home/caches/indexes/issues' already exists
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.moveDirectory(FileUtils.java:1739)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.moveDirectoryToDirectory(FileUtils.java:1781)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager$ReplaceIndexRunner.replaceIndexes(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:452)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager$ReplaceIndexRunner.run(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:370)
	... 22 more
{noformat}

The same code path is triggered when nodes perform major index related work in JIRA clusters, such as after a node completes a reindex or an administrator initiates a node to node index copy.

h4. Summary:

When JIRA is performing major operations on the Lucene index it puts in place a barrier to prevent simultaneous access to the index. This barrier was bypassed by a change introduced in JIRA 6.4. As a result the index may be written to with an incomplete record of issues.

h4. Workaround

# Take all nodes out of rotation. This avoids concurrency.
# Shut down all but one node.
# Perform the lock-and-reindex on the remaining node.
# Start the other nodes and wait for index replication to complete.
# Put all nodes back into rotation.
fields.summary: Index corruption when restoring index from snapshot

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59720].
  {panel}

When in Adobe Fireworks (or similar software), if you create a text box and copy the selected text then paste into JIRA, an image is uploaded rather than text. It would be nice if there was a setting in JIRA that specified preference for copied data to come in as text.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open Adobe Fireworks (or similar software)
2. Select text
3. Copy selection to clipboard
4. Switch to Jira
5. Edit an existing ticket
6. Place focus in ticket description
7. Hit ctrl-v

Expected results:
Text on clipboard is pasted into description

Actual results:
Screenshot attachment dialog pops up with bitmap of text
fields.summary: Pasting data that can be interpreted as text or image data based on JIRA setting

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59713].
  {panel}

The documentation for JIRA Software 7.0's Project Import tool, at [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/restoring-a-project-from-backup-749383456.html], lacks clarity when it comes to importing Agile-style JIRA projects.  Please revise the documentaiton to address the following four issues, numbered A, B, C & D:

A) When importing JIRA Agile projects from one JIRA Software 7.0 system to another, the user is in a Catch-22 situation regarding workflows.  The Project Import documentation states:

{color:#14892c}"If you wish to retain a customized workflow from your backup, you will need to create a new workflow in your target JIRA instance and manually edit the new workflow (e.g. create steps and transitions) to reflect your old workflow "
. . .
"Do not use the JIRA functionality for exporting and importing workflow XML definitions, to copy your backup workflow to your target JIRA instance."
{color}

However, when it comes to Aglie projects, the workflow itself contains comments which contradict the above documentation:

{color:#654982}"This workflow is managed internally by JIRA Agile. Do not manually modify this workflow"{color}

Please provide clarification what to do specifically regarding workflows when importing Agile-style projects:

1) Should the workflow be recreated manually?
2) Should the workflow be exported as XML, then imported on the target system and manually revised?
3) Or is it best to use the workflow that is created when the empty project is first created on the target system?

B) When creating the new empty projects on the target system, is it OK to create a non-Agile project, then later associate the project with an Agile workflow?  Or must the new empty projects be created as Agile projects from the start (via an Agile-enabled project template)?

C) I often assign the same workflow to multiple non-Aglie projects.  Is it possible for Agile projects to have shared workflows?  Or must each Agile project have a distinct workflow?

D) Please provide some sample SQL queries that could be used to re-establish Boards and other Agile data that the JIRA Software 7.0 Import Tool currently skips.  So far, the best procedure I have found is at [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/18448856/how-to-import-jira-agile-sprint-data-project-by-project], but there is no way for me to know whether these steps are correct and complete.
fields.summary: Clarify documentation for using Project Import tool

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59710].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Currently importing project with Subtask from Trello using JIRA's External Import will result in following error:

{quote}Could not import checklists: there is no SubTask issue type in the target JIRA project.{quote}

This happens because JIRA's subtask is named *Sub-Tasks*.

h3. Environment
6.4.12 -> JIRA 7.0.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open External System Import in JIRA
# Import Trello Project which contains subtask

h3. Expected Results
All the issues including subtask imported correctly with their respective issue type.

h3. Actual Results
User is prompted with the following error:

{quote}Could not import checklists: there is no SubTask issue type in the target JIRA project.{quote}

h3.Workaround
Create task type Sub-Task with name "SubTask" for the Project imported from Trello
fields.summary: Trello Sub-Task Issue Type

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59703].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
-  Client encountered production outage while users are running JQL query and JIRA Admin rename one of the default out of the box statuses. Client also mentioned that the jira default workflow is restricted why not restrict the ability to rename the statuses within it. 


h3. Suggested Solution
-  Prevent user to edit out of the box statuses and force the user to copy/create a new status.
fields.summary: Restrict Out of the Box statuses not to be edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59702].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Many API endpoints use the startat parameter to determine the index starting point, and then maxresults parameter to determine how many results will be returned. The groups endpoint instead users to [start:end] endpoint to determine which results will be returned.

For example, for users 50-100 it is:

* https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=jira-users&expand=users[50:100]

Whereas you would expect

* https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=jira-users&expand=users&startAt=50&maxResults=100


The inconsistent user experience makes it difficult to know which method to use.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make all rest endpoints consistent in the way they handle startat and maxresults.

h3. Workaround

The [JIRA REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/] typically specifies how it should be used, refer to the docs if you're not sure which to use.
fields.summary: JIRA API request for groups doesn't recognise startat or maxresult parameter
